{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy (HIE) is a type of brain damage that occurs when the brain doesn't receive enough oxygen. According to the documents, seizures are a common symptom of HIE. There is no mention of the condition affecting the lower limbs more than the upper limbs, the proximal muscles more than the distal muscles, or the trunk being involved.", "answer_choice": "C"}
